address.streetAddress: 163 John St Corner of Queen St. & John St

reviews.title: Not for sensitive cry babies
text: The people writing bad reviews obviously didn’t know going in that jokes about audience members are standard at literally any comedy show. They must have gotten their feelings hurt. This was a cute set up and had some really great comedians. I’d say I enjoyed 4/5 of the acts (some people just aren’t on their game 24/7) but over all I loved this spot. Keep it up

reviews.title: Waste of money
text: Honestly it was the worst comedy show I’ve ever seen. So bad it was almost funny. I paid good money to listen to guys that I make a point of avoiding at the bar. Guys with no self-esteem who prefer to blame women and gay people for their problems rather than try empathy or self reflection. Then blame the crowd for not laughing.  Painful. Headliner was pretty good. Saved what was a mess.

reviews.title: Terrible comedians
text: The club was super small and the comedians were the worst any of us had ever seen perform. They lacked originality and instead made awful raunchy jokes that were far from funny and instead just showcased their lack of intelligence. With even a little more talent they could have been able to make raunchy jokes funny, but instead they made insensitive jokes about topics they knew nothing about.

reviews.title: Touch and go
text: Enjoy the vibe in the east end. The bar could have a bit more options. Comedians are touch and go. Seen hilarious artists like Ernie Vicente and Sandra Battigliani. Comedians can also bomb HARD here and it’s such a small venue you can’t escape and it you want to die it gets so cringey and embarrassing. Dan Guiry has the worst melt down I’ve ever seen, didn’t seem to have a comedy set? Appeared too drunk to being doing stand up and when he didn’t get the laughs he wanted devolved into total anger towards audience and super banal predictable  sex/ race/ tropes. On a good night a great laugh on a bad night it can be very bad as it becomes SO AWKWARD when the comedian is visually melting down on stage in anxiety.

reviews.title: Worst comedy ever
text: Small space, people sit way to close. I was there for a Sunday night show, didn't know boo-ing and heckling was the theme. I was planning on having drinks and enjoying good comedy. The comedians had no jokes or acts, they were targeting us and other audience to make up bullying-jokes. The rest of the audience were throwing hate speech at so many levels and grounds at the comedians. It felt like we were in a roast show, just throwing insults at anyone and everyone. You can tell when a comedian is making a joke vs using the stage to make hate speech. Never going back here! I have been to many other comedy clubs for cheaper or same price, and much better quality!

reviews.title: Neat little corner club
text: While planning on what we wanted to do when we came to Toronto we came across this place and decided to give it a try. It's a very small little comedy club. Has a small bar, few choice for liquor and beer and took cash only. The comedy area had about 15 chairs lined up on each side of the walls with 6 tables in the middle that had two chairs in front of that. There were about 8 local comedians, some were good. Neat little place if you're looking for something to do.

reviews.title: One of my favourite comedy clubs
text: EVERY time I am in Toronto, which is approx. 1-2 a month, I always visit corner comedy club. For a great price their clubs offer some of Toronto and Canada's BEST comedians!
Any night you will see a great line-up of great comedians including Ryan Long, Paul Thompson, Rick Rowley, Dan Guiry, JJ Liberman, Danny Polishchuk, Kris Bonaparte and Mony Scott.
GO TO CORNER COMEDY CLUB, ALL THREE LOCATIONS!! The new Niagara location is gorgeous!

reviews.title: 80%  borirng  childish  dirty  humor
text: The  venue is cute  but the rest of the evening  was not the cup of tea  for  my wife and i.  5  of the  6  comedians  were  miserable  and sad  and baed their humor  on their sex lives.  To  much information.  Thankfully  one comic  was actually funny  and entertaining. 10  minutes of enjoyment  and  1  hour  of  boredom  and rudeness.  My  wife and I wished we were  somewhere else.

reviews.title: Ok funny
text: Very small venue. Get there early or you’ll end up sitting right up front.  Literally within arms reach or the comedian. We saw about 4-5 comedians. Two of them were funny the other ones appeared to be high. As high as a cloud.  If you’re driving give yourself time for parking and read the posted signs. Some areas require permits. The entrance is on the side of the building. Drinks are pretty cheap. Two beers cost us less than $20CAD. They only have three types of beer which makes it easy to choose. Overall value was good.

reviews.title: Terrible Show, Terrible Prices, Worse Venue
text: I can't believe the positive reviews here can possibly be real. It's a back alley door which could be cool I guess except you go into this windowless moldy smelling basement under some store. It's a long bar with a tiny space to walk through to get to the room which is like 12 seats and a stage in front of a window to the street. The comedians were the worst. We thought maybe the show it self was a joke the comedians were so bad. It cost something like $17 each to get in so not sure where these reviewers got $5 and $10 tickets but even then it is a rip off. Beers were like $10 each if you tip at all. Once you sit you are trapped because it is so small and tight you are rammed in like sardines. It felt like the host is also the owner and the comedians are all friends, like they put their money together to rent a club of their own because the real clubs won't put them on because they are just not funny. This show and club were a huge fail for us. The host was openly rude. Terrible management. Staff not rude but it is like they were not happy to be there and working for those people. Love the city and will visit again but not this club. It is like they are playing a game instead of actually trying to run a real club people might actually enjoy. Felt like everyone was disappointed and miserable which is extra terrible for a place that's supposed to be doing comedy.

reviews.title: Best comedy club in Toronto
text: We got pulled off the street by the owner who told us we would not be disappointed with good laughs and cheap beer.
HE WAS RIGHT!!!!
So funny.  Great mix of established and up and coming comics.  If you love New York style comedy venues that are small and rich with great talent come to this place.
I would argue much better than the conventional comedy clubs in this city.  Very refreshing!!

reviews.title: Best Comedy Club in Toronto
text: Tips: For guaranteed seats, make sure you make a reservation as this is a small venue. Entrance is at the side door.

The day that I came here, David Koechner from Anchorman was the headliner. He was in town filming a movie with Gerrard Butler and Willem Dafoe. It's pretty cool to pay 10 dollars and get to see a hollywood star performing stand-up. Drinks are affordable. I will definitely recommend it.

reviews.title: Toronto's NEWEST comedy club!
text: Great space. Very intimate and cozy. Cheapest bar for drinks anywhere in the area. Low admission costs and high quality performances. Great before or after a dinner or even to start a night out on the town.

reviews.title: Great Value - $10 comedy show
text: We recently visited the Corner Comedy Club EAST (946 Queen Street East location) and we had a fantastic time. The price ($10) is extremely affordable and you get a wide variety of talent to keep you laughing for the entire 1.5 to 2 hour time slot.
The venue is ultra small and makes for a VERY interactive setting. The MCs are fantastic and we had an absolute blast. There was a drink special of bottled MGD + shot for $12.
Kudos to the Corner Comedy Team. It was a LOT of fun.

reviews.title: This comedy club is small but you leave with a smile.
text: This comedy club is small, I mean really small! You literally enter the club from the side entrance and have like just a few steps to the stage.
The acts were so funny that you forget about the size of the club. It's not about the size but what it brings and it brings some top quality acts. My face was hurting. That's how funny it was.

reviews.title: For sardines only....
text: Not good value for money at all. For $10 you get packed into a tiny room like the subway at rush hour. I actually woke up the next day with back problems. It's $8 for a small bottle of beer as well which is insulting. The comedians themselves were good but with 10 minute sets you never get a chance to be invested in their act. As a result i can't remember any of their names. It just feels like a big rip off when the barmaid is also the waitress and ticket vendor. What am i paying for?

reviews.title: Good Comedy Show for Only 10$
text: Went to see a Saturday night show and was pleasantly surprised by this small charming venue.
The show was awesome, got to see 6 comedians and one mc in about a 1.5 hour show.
The standup has good! I'm sure the comedians vary from night to night, but overall I was impressed.
Something to consider for sure!

reviews.title: The only thing funny was how sad it was
text: I have literally never seen stand up comedy this bad. Went here to check out some comedy, and was already a bit buzzed so had my expectations and standards lowered. Charged me 5 bucks to get in, and it was a small place, hardly anyone there, and a slew of comics that were just awful. It was not good. I felt as though I might have done a better job, and that is impressive, because I would never think that I am funny enough.

reviews.title: Yea.......no
text: I'm from NY...have seen hundreds of amazing comedians....theres raunchy funny, and then there's raunchy not funny. Canadian humor left me thinking y'all are  incestial whackjobs. ...but for a small venue, lots of wannabe improvers....for $10. It was a time filler I guess.

reviews.title: Great Laughs and Cheap Drinks
text: We went for a Saturday night show with 6 comedians performing in an hour. All of them were amazing, as was the host. It is a small club, but the atmosphere is friendly, personal and interactive which really adds to the experience. The bar is basic, but well priced and the bartenders are very attentive. Its worth it to get there about 20 minutes early as seating is first come first serve. Reservations are a must as this place regularly sells out especially on the weekends.

reviews.title: small but funny
text: we went here on a saturday night and expected it to be a bit busier. the place is very small and therefore the atmosphere not that great however good selection of comedians and cheap entry price.

reviews.title: Brilliant night, no holds barred comedy!!
text: Four of us visited this comedy club on our first night in Toronto. It didn't look like much from the side street and in fact we were a bit dubious / nervous about going in through this tiny side street door; however we decided just to give it a go and it DID NOT DISAPPOINT!! We had an absolutely brilliant night and laughed hard from start to finish. Highly recommended!!!!!! Drinks are also reasonably priced and they stock Magners which we Irish were very pleased about! Definitely visit this place for a great night and plenty of laughs!

reviews.title: Great Toronto experience
text: Really funny show. At $10/person it is a steal! Got to see 5 comics plus a host and they were all really funny. The place is super small which gives it a cool vibe. Also the owner is super friendly and makes sure people have fun. I highly recommend this place. SIDENOTE: make reservations -- the place only sits 30 people and they sell out.
